sentences.sContent: New drugs are producing remarkable results.
sentences.sCn: 新药正在产生显著的效果。

sentences.sContent: a rise in sea level produced by climatic change
sentences.sCn: 由气候变化引起的海平面升高

sentences.sContent: As a policy, it did not produce the desired effect.
sentences.sCn: 作为一项政策，它并未产生预期的效果。

sentences.sContent: He produced a letter from his pocket.
sentences.sCn: 他从口袋里掏出一封信来。

sentences.sContent: ...encounter with writer'sblock--I was not able to produce anything for three years...
...There are two ways to interpret Plutarch when he suggests that a critic should be able to produce a better in its place...
...Writers may experience periods of time in their life when they just can't produce anything...
...it is a very easy matter; but to produce a better in its place is a work extremely troublesome...
...Frozen produce is still produce; canned tomatoes are still tomatoes...
...Americans have basically decided that they don't really want to produce all their Own oil...
...Books--especially books the average person could afford--haven't been around long enough to produce evolutionary change in humans...
...Laws should be passed to make it illegal to produce overly sweet foods or drinks...
...Solar homes produce the most power on the hot sunny afternoons when everyone rushes home to turn up the air conditioner...
...ZEH communities are the leading edge of technologies that might someday create houses that produce as much energy as they consume...

words.tran: 能生产的；生产的，生产性的；多产的；富有成效的
生产力；生产率；生产能力
制作人，制片人；生产者；发生器
赢利性；生产率，生产能力；多产性
产生；制造（produce的过去式和过去分词）；创作

trans.tranOther: to cause a particular result or effect
